intro: Chaerophyllum azorellaceum, commonly known as the Azorean cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Azores. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to the humid, temperate climate of its native region. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within the Azores.
